cz.syntea.xdef.sys

Class FUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.syntea.xdef.sys.FUtils
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SUtils

    public class FUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Collection of utilities to handle with files.

    • Method Detail

      • getUsableSpace

        public static long getUsableSpace(java.io.File file)
        Get usable space of file system of the file. Note this method returns the reasonable value starting from java version 1.6. Otherwise it returns Long.MAX_VALUE.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be checked.
        Returns:
        number of bytes available in the filesystem of the file or return 0 if filesystem not exists or if it is not allowed to write to the file.

                                    boolean create)
                             throws SException
        Check directory and create it if it doesn't exist.
        Parameters:
        path - full path to the directory.
        create - If true the directory is created if it not exists yet.
        Returns:
        java.io.File object with directory.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS020 Can't create directory: {dir}

      • compareFile

        public static long compareFile(java.lang.String fn1,
                               java.lang.String fn2)
        Compare files. Returns -1 if the file contents are equal, otherwise returns the offset of the first difference.
        Parameters:
        fn1 - name of the first file.
        fn2 - name of the second file.
        Returns:
        -1 if both files are equal, otherwise return the offset of the first difference. If a file doesn't exist or if it is not readable return 0;

      • compareFile

        public static long compareFile(java.io.File f1,
                               java.io.File f2)
        Compare files. Returns -1 if the file contents are equal, otherwise returns the offset of the first difference.
        Parameters:
        f1 - first file.
        f2 - second file.
        Returns:
        -1 if the files are equal, otherwise return the offset of the first difference. If a file doesn't exist or if it is not readable return 0;

      • filesEqual

        public static boolean filesEqual(java.io.File f1,
                                 java.io.File f2)
        Check if contents of files are equal. Returns true if files are equal, otherwise return false.
        Parameters:
        f1 - first file.
        f2 - second file.
        Returns:
        true if contents of files are equal, false otherwise. If a file doesn't exist or if it is not readable return also false.

      • compareFile

        public static long compareFile(java.io.InputStream f1,
                               java.io.InputStream f2)
        Compare streams. Returns -1 if contents are equal, otherwise returns the index of the first difference.
        Parameters:
        f1 - first file.
        f2 - second file.
        Returns:
        -1 if the files are equal, otherwise the offset of the first difference. If a file doesn't exist or if it is not readable return 0;

                              boolean append)
                       throws SException
        Copy InputStream to the file given by the name.
        Parameters:

        append - if true input is appended to output.
        Throws:
        SException -

        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS026 Can't create file: {file}

        • SYS038 File is too big

      • copyToFile

        public static void copyToFile(java.io.File inFile,
                              java.io.File outFile,
                              boolean append)
                       throws SException
        Copy input file to the output file given by the name. If argument append is true and if output file already exists then the input data are appended to the output data, otherwise the output file is written over by the input data.
        Parameters:
        inFile - input file.
        outFile - file to which the copy is made.
        append - if true the input is appended to the output file.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS026 Can't create file: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS030 File already exists
        • SYS036 Program exception
        • SYS038 File is too big

      • copyToFile

        public static void copyToFile(java.io.File inFile,
                              java.io.File outFile)
                       throws SException
        Copy input file to the output file given by the name.
        Parameters:
        inFile - input file.
        outFile - file to which the copy is made. If the file already exists it is written over by the input data.

      • xcopy

        public static void xcopy(java.io.File[] from,
                         java.io.File to,
                         java.lang.String[] exclude,
                         boolean deep)
                  throws SException
        Copy files (and directories) from given list to the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        from - list of input files
        to - directory where files to be copied.
        exclude - array with exclude list. If path ends with an string from exclude list the input item is skipped. Name of an directory must end with separator character "/". If this argument is null or the empty array then no files are excluded.
        deep - if false the directories are skipped.
        Throws:
        SException - if an error occurs.

      • xcopy

        public static void xcopy(java.lang.String fromDir,
                         java.lang.String toDir,
                         java.lang.String[] excludes,
                         boolean deep)
                  throws SException
        Copy files from source directory to the target directory.
        Parameters:
        fromDir - list of input files
        toDir - directory where files to be copied.
        excludes - array with exclude list. If path ends with an string from exclude list the input item is skipped. Name of an directory must end with separator character "/".
        deep - if false the directories are skipped otherwise copy also directories.
        Throws:
        SException - if an error occurs.

      • readToStringBuffer

        public static java.lang.StringBuffer readToStringBuffer(java.io.InputStream in,
                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                                        java.lang.String encoding)
                                                 throws SException
        Read input stream to StringBuffer (decoded from given character set table).
        Parameters:
        in - input stream.
        sb - StringBuffer where to write. If this argument is null then the new StringBuffer is created.
        encoding - The name of encoding table. If this argument is null the default encoding is applied.
        Returns:
        StringBuffer with result.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS029 Can't read input stream
        • SYS035 Unsupported character set name
        • SYS036 Program exception

      • readToStringBuffer

        public static java.lang.StringBuffer readToStringBuffer(java.io.Reader is,
                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
                                                 throws SException
        Read input stream to StringBuffer.
        Parameters:
        is - input reader.
        sb - StringBuffer where to write. If this argument is null the new StringBuffer is created.
        Returns:
        StringBuffer with result.
        Throws:
        SException - SYS029 Can't read input stream

      • readToStringBuffer

        public static java.lang.StringBuffer readToStringBuffer(java.io.File file,
                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer sb,
                                                        java.lang.String encoding)
                                                 throws SException
        Read file to StringBuffer (decoded from given character set table).
        Parameters:
        file - input file.
        sb - StringBuffer where to write. If this argument is null the new StringBuffer is created.
        encoding - name of encoding table. If this argument is null the decoding from default system character set table is used.
        Returns:
        StringBuffer with result.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist
        • SYS028 Can't read file
        • SYS035 Unsupported character set name
        • SYS036 Program exception

      • readToStringBuffer

                                                        java.lang.StringBuffer buf)
                                                 throws SException

        StringBuffer with result.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}

                             boolean subdir)
        Very dangerous: if the file is directory it deletes all subdirectories!
        Parameters:
        files - array of files to be deleted.
        subdir - if true then also subdirectories are deleted.

      • secureCopy

        public static void secureCopy(java.io.InputStream is,
                              java.lang.String pathname)
                       throws SException
        Secure copy InputStream to the file. First the input is saved to the temporary file and after the copy was finished the file is renamed to the file given by parameter. If the file of same name already exists then it is first renamed to the file with added extension ".bak".
        Parameters:
        is - input stream.
        pathname - name of file to which the copy will be made.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS021 Can't delete file: {file}
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS026 Can't create file: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS031 Can't rename file {f1} to {f2}
        • SYS036 Program exception: {msg}

      • secureCopy

                              java.io.File file)
                       throws SException

        is - input stream.
        file - file to which the copy will be made.

      • getFileGroup

        public static java.io.File[] getFileGroup(java.lang.String wildName)
        Get array of existing files represented by given argument. The argument can either represent one concrete file or it can represent a set of files with wildcards '*' and/or '?'. Comparing is case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        wildName - file name (wildcards are accepted) .
        Returns:
        array of existing files according to argument.

      • getFileGroup

        public static java.io.File[] getFileGroup(java.lang.String wildName,
                                          boolean caseInsensitive)
        Get array of existing files represented by given argument. The argument can either represent one concrete file or it can represent a set of files with wildcards '*' and/or '?'.
        Parameters:
        wildName - file name (wildcards are accepted) .
        caseInsensitive - if true then name comparing is case insensitive.
        Returns:
        array of existing files according to argument.

      • getFileGroup

        public static java.io.File[] getFileGroup(java.lang.String[] wildNames)
        Get array of existing files represented by given argument array. The argument array is an array of strings where each one can either represent one concrete file or it can represent a set of files with wildcards '*' and/or '?'. Comparing is case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        wildNames - array of file names.
        Returns:
        array of existing files according to argument.

      • getFileGroup

        public static java.io.File[] getFileGroup(java.lang.String[] wildNames,
                                          boolean caseInsensitive)
        Get array of existing files represented by given argument array. The argument array is an array of strings where each one can either represent one concrete file or it can represent a set of files with wildcards '*' and/or '?'.
        Parameters:
        wildNames - array of file names.
        caseInsensitive - if true then name comparing is case insensitive.
        Returns:
        array of existing files according to argument.

      • filesToZip

        public static long filesToZip(java.lang.String fileList,
                              java.lang.String ignoreList,
                              java.io.File file)
                       throws SException
        Store files given by list to zip archive file. Entries of list are separated by ";". If the entry is directory there are archived all files from the subtree from this directory. The files with extensions given by argument ignore are ignored. Wild characters in file names (i.e. "*" or '?') are accepted.
        Parameters:
        fileList - list of files separated by ";".
        ignoreList - list of extensions to be ignored(separated by ";").
        file - archive file.
        Returns:
        sum of length of all archived files.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS073 Zip file list is empty

      • filesToZip

        public static long filesToZip(java.io.File[] list,
                              java.lang.String[] skipExtensions,
                              java.io.File file)
                       throws SException
        Store files given by list to zip archive file. Entries of list are separated by ";". If the entry is directory there are archived all files from the subtree from this directory.
        Parameters:
        list - list of files.
        skipExtensions - array of extensions to be ignored.
        file - archive file.
        Returns:
        sum of length of all archived files.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS073 Zip file list is empty

      • filesToZip

        public static long filesToZip(java.io.File[] list,
                              java.lang.String[] skipExtensions,
                              java.io.OutputStream out,
                              java.lang.String zFileName)
                       throws SException
        Store files given by list to zip archive file. Entries of list are separated by ";". If the entry is directory there are archived all files from the subtree from this directory.
        Parameters:
        list - The list of files.
        skipExtensions - array of extensions to be ignored.
        out - archive file stream.
        zFileName - name of archive (used just for error reports).
        Returns:
        sum of length of all archived files.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS073 Zip file list is empty

      • filesFromZip

        public static long filesFromZip(java.io.File dir,
                                java.io.File archive,
                                java.lang.String backupExtension)
                         throws SException
        Extract files from archive and store them to given directory.
        Parameters:
        dir - directory for files to be stored.
        archive - archive file.
        backupExtension - If null, files are replaced, otherwise the original file is renamed to given extension.
        Returns:
        sum of length of all extracted files.
        Throws:
        SException -
        • SYS023 Can't write to file: {file}
        • SYS024 File doesn't exist: {file}
        • SYS026 Can't create file: {file}
        • SYS028 Can't read file: {file}
        • SYS032 File is not directory: {file}
        • SYS038 File is too big: {file}
